review: Mmmm for the chicken tequila fettuccine and pesto cream penne.

Amazing service at a great location. My friend and I came here on our lunch hour and indulged in their white pizza, which was good but maybe a little oily and could have used more garlic. We also started with mojitos, which were good! and had their spinach and artichoke dip, which was absolutely delicious. That dip, yum. Our waitress was really nice and bubbly, everyone said goodbye to us as we left, it was awesome. They also have a newly designed menu with more delicious and healthier options. Nice job, CPK.  Parking is validated.

I had a great experience at this CPK. As soon as we walked in we were greeted and seated right away by a very friendly server. Our server Greg was awesome. He didn't let any of our drinks get empty, checked on us after we received our meals, and had great suggestions for food.  We had the hummus and the 5 cheese pizza, both were delicious. Thank you staff for a delightful dining experience.

Came here Easter Sunday around 6:30ish. I really didn't know that this is a much smaller CPK than the usual ones, but we were seated within 5 minutes. Our waitress was prompt with handing us our menus, bread and water. We both ordered our separate pizzas and within 10 minutes of putting in our order, we both got our pizzas. I had to dock this spot a star because our pizzas came out luke-warm, which is unusual because when we order our pizzas at other locations, that isn't the case. No, it didn't take the taste away from the food, just an observation. Overall, this location makes the cut. On top of the luke-warm food, took another star off for parking situation, as you're either stuck looking for metered parking (although it's free on Sundays, yay!) or their parking structure, where you get 90 mins. free with validation.

Horrible service and management. My family are big fans of CPK, but this one is terribly run. My seven month pregnant wife had dinner there tonight with our six year old daughter. When the server was being rude my wife asked for the Manager. When she arrived she doubled down on being rude. My wife left in tears. Boycott this place.

OMG!!!!  Think Chuck E Cheese on CRACK!!! A LOT of CRACK!!! This place is down right scary unless you really, really, really like, no! LOVE KIDS! I for one can't stand them! Yes, I have one and that's about all I can handle. BIG Mistake!!! to ask my little human where he'd like to go for dinner the other night - his first choice was Dan Tana's (that's my boy) but last minute No! then he said Bucca de Beppo or whatever the name of the place was and I just didn't feel like dealing with the whole Universal City Walk thing then he said CPK. Shoot me now! is what I thought when we walked in - the hostess grabbed some menus and went to seat us and I thought I was going to die. There was not one quiet table in the place and every single table had kids at it - LOTS of them! I ended up asking to sit at the first two seats at the bar, closest to the door. And get this - even another parent was seated at the further end of the bar with TWO KIDS! Shit, I don't know how everyone in the place doesn't need a drink OR FIVE to deal with the commotion in here. I thought it was an elementary or preschool fundraiser night - Nope! The staff confirmed it's ALWAYS like this. Holy shit! Save me now. That was the last time I will step foot in this place.  Curbside to go is the way to go, unless you wish to dine in hell. Mommy and Me class, meets Gymboree, meets the Circus or wherever the hell people take young kids. Just thinking of what the adult to child ratio of this place is raises my blood pressure. NOT my cup of tea. The food on the other hand is CPK - it's ok but I'd rather have chain American Italian somewhere else where the kids are few and far between.
This is by far one of my favorite places to eat. Everything on the menu is yummy, especially their misa salad, which I order every time I go there. Good service too.

I was first introduced to CPK back in Malaysia and am happy to say that my go-to dish, the BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad tastes exactly the same in both countries!haha..Apart from the salad ( which I really X3 like!), the pizzas are good too! The service at this outlet is always good - and I like that it's always quite full when I go. Recommended.

I've been eating at CPK's for more than 2 decades. I haven't been in for a while because there are so many choices these days, however, CPK is constantly renovating themselves by offering new menu items. We order Kung Pao Ck, Thai Pizza, and a Chicken dish with Chimichurri. All excellent. The strawberry shortcake is a bad version of Cheesecake factory, so don't order that one, stay with the velvet cheesecake instead
its good fresh and always something different to eat. the best fish tacos that i have ever had.
Always the safe, go to place for a nice meal. Great for kids and families. Food quality is always consistently good, and they introduce seasonal offerings.

AFTERSCHOOL PROBLEM SOLVER FOR HUNGER PANGS!  Tasty chain restaurant (HATE CHAINS) that my children LOVE to frequent! :)  Chicken tequila is a favorite, along with BBQ chicken pizza. Too bad they nixed the Miso salad, my girls loved that.  Decent spot, always quick and easy.  :)

I love cpk pizza and their salads. I have had good and bad experiences at this location. The good experience would be great tasting food and appetizers. The bad experience I had was slow service, rude waiter, and slow food. But overall on a good day I guess, its a great place to eat.

Worst CPK I have ever been too. My friend and I walked out because our server never came to take our order.  We waited 15 minutes before leaving, which was plenty of time for our server to show his face. I will never come to this CPK again.

Very disappointed with this CPK. I decided to cater with them for my sons party, called and spoke to Toni and she went over my order with me then said to call back day before party to place order. So I do, the guy who took my order told me that they'd be able to deliver since it was such a big order. So I say ok great. An hour before my sons party they call to say oh hey sorry we can't deliver, we don't delver on weekends. I was so pissed. Why would you wait to call that late? You didn't think it'd be smart to call when you opened and first saw my order? So I send my husband, they completely messed up my order. And on top of that I had ordered 2 Mac n Cheese trays that I was told they had and cost $40, well they gave me 2 kid orders of Mac n Cheese. Which was not enough to feed the 34 kids at the party. Because they messed up they did comp the pizza, but yet 4 salads and 2 kids orders of Mac n Cheese cost me $200? How does that even add up? Such a horrible experience. We love CPK but after this they're lost my business.

I've eaten in and taken out and everything is always spot on. The bartender's friendly, the food is good, and the location is easy. As with most Ventura Blvd spots, though, parking can be a hassle so today I ordered curbside. My order taker was very sweet and thorough and my order was accurate, with hot & cold elements packaged separately.  Note: they do have a validated parking lot beneath the building but I try to avoid those because my car has low clearance.

Not impressed with my first experience at CPK. My waiter was too soft spoken and not particularly friendly, my drink (Paloma) was flat even though Sierra Mist was an ingredient, my quinoa and arugula salad was dry, and my Hawaiian pizza was lukewarm with an undercooked crust. I might come off as a chronic complainer in this review, but I assure you...I am pretty easy to please when it comes to food. This place just sucked.

I am happy for people that enjoy CPK really.  I used to be one of those people.  My intention as a solo lunch lady was to come in for the chicken lettuce wraps, eat food have a coke and leave. When the food arrived I was quite hungry.  For a minute I thought wow this really hits the spot... it sure does. I pulled a coiled METAL ROD out of the chicken.  How I found it I will never know because the chicken looks like confetti and you could barely see it.  I almost put it in my mouth and look down. When the server asked how my lunch was I showed him and he got his manager right away.  He took it back to the kitchen and when I asked him what it was he said, "oh that's a piece of the machine we use to cut our mushrooms." Oh good to know for some reason I thought it was a piece of chicken. I was accomodated and the chef for some reason was chatting up friends and standing near the door.  He never once approached me or apologized as I left he said, "don't worry I catch hell for this."  Nothing remotely like I would expect him to react and that was certainly not my intention. I think from now on I can make lettuce wraps at home.
You can expect consistent quality and taste from CPK and everything is well proportioned and tasty.  Service is always friendly, parking is valet only (free beside the tip).

When I used to live in the area, I went to this location alot. I have also been to the one in Sherman Oaks, Tarzana, Woodlands Hills and Ventura most recently. I love this place! I'm huge fan of salads and they some of the best, hands down! The pasta is great and the pizza is delicious. I like their ice tea. I have had kid's portions, too and the kid's sundae. It was so good!!!
Bu far my favorite ceaser salad I've ever had! I ordered the half size! Fills me up and very reasonably priced!

I'm a man of simple tastes. Get me a 7.99 medium pizza with a 6 pack of a good brew and turn on Netflix and I'm in heaven on a perfect date night.  But every once in a while I do have to class it up a bit, you know, cuz girls like to be taken out, and I'm completely fine with that.  I came to CPK after my sister's HS graduation and wasn't expecting much, but I was wrong. I swear I didn't puff the magic dragon before walking in, but I ate my whole pizza and then was eating a slice off of my sister's plate and another one that was on the table. I'm surprised I didn't try to reach over to the table next to me and cop a slice before they cleaned off their table.  CPK is definitely a nice date night place. The main downside for me is that for what it is, Pizza, it is on the pricey side. I really wanted a drink also, but I think pints were being sold at 6-8 which is ok... I guess? It's not unreasonable, but it is high.  I'll be back. It's not a weekly thing so splurging a bit on quality pizza is worth it to me.
Super reliable pizza, & friendly staff. Park in the 30 minute parking spot instead of valeting & you only pay $2 for parking :D

I tried California pizza Kitchen for the first time  and i order the Thai Pizza I got it to go and it was NOT good,  I had the frozen one before and it was GOOD, So I thought the freshly made thai pizza would be even better. NOT I was so wrong it was salty and I could not taste the peanut sauce, I will not go there again :(

I'm a big fan of CPK's in general. I eat form there quite a bit. Overall, I would give them a five for the quality of their food. It is a lite pricey, but well worth it to me. I think this one gets a four because of all the CPK's in the area, I like the setup of this one the least. The parking is kind of a drag as is the one in Glendale. But overall, the service, the food, it's all good.
Good salads here .. Also must try the tequila pasta .. Otherwise this place is ok.. The drinks are weak and service is pretty good
I love, love, love this location!! Vanessa and Wendy are my 2 favorite ppl to see there!! I always feel welcomed!! For sure one of my favorite places for lunch!!

Half order Chinese chicken salad VERY SKIMPY on the chicken! Probably about 1 ounce of chicken-- that's it! Told the waitress AND the manager, and all they said was  "Sorry about that.  Will tell the chef." Too bad this place has gone downhill.

I ordered Curb Side food.... Coming from making pizza as a side job a while back I can say they let the pizza dough sit out too long. You can tell by how chewy the pizza dough became when they made our food.  I ordered a Gluten Free pizza as well as a normal. Both were very much in the same way except they decided to burn the gluten free and skimp on the cheese, amazing since it costs more.    The only decent thing was the salad some things you can't mess up.   I've been to many CPK restaurants. This is the only one I know of that hasn't been good or up to par.  Side note: When slapping the dough for a pizza, if its not even, it gets thin in spots and thick in others. That probably attributed a little to how chewy this pizza was as well.

I've got celiac -- diagnosed over 20 years ago, way before gluten-free was cool.  Never thought I'd eat real pizza again.  I still don't, but in that amount of time I've forgotten what real pizza is like and CPK's gluten-free "pizza" isn't half bad.  It'd be 5 stars, but they always burn the edges.  And it's best if you take it home and reheat it on a heavy griddle or a couple slices at a time in a  cast iron pan.

I really love the food here... and that they keep updating their menu and adding to it. The staff seems very friendly.  The only thing that prevents me from giving a 5 Star is because a few times I've been here, it's been so loud and It's sometimes hard to have a quiet meal.  So if you come at off times, I'd say 5 star... sitting next to the annoying loud people next to me? Maybe order To Go.  ;)

Always over-crowded at dinner.  Usually takes a long time to be seated and the wait for the food is extraordinarily long.  It doesn't help that more than half the tables are families with young kids who get extremely (and understandably) frustrated and antsy due to the long waits.
Food is always been good here. The service hasn't always been great. They're so slow here and we have a big family. Not recommended for large parties. Seems like there short staffed.
Took forever to be seated. Nice waiter.

I know this sounds random but, their deserts are amazing.  I went in to get something sweet for me and my girlfriend and found the best dessert.  We had the butter cake and I have to say it is the best.  You have to try it with a scoop of hagan adz ice cream.  Its the BEST!!!
Great place to go to with family I always come here with my kids and always enjoy it. It's a kid friendly place and adults love it too :)

Visited CPK for the first time in months.  My son ordered the fish tacos and I ordered the Jambalaya Pasta. My dish was fine, but my son received fish that was burnt. Of course the cooks put the burnt side if the face down, so it was not noticeable. Needless to say, we sent it back. The server, Blake was extremely embarrassed and replaced the order. I let the manager know the dinner was inedible. He could care less. Now I remember why I stop coming here. The quality of the food has diminished immensely. I am very disappointed.
Been a year since I've been here, service & food has greatly improved, ask for Sean, GREAT server!
This place is really good... I really love how they make the pizzas they are delicious... I love their veggie pizza and mushroom pizza... Try them if you have not tried.... You will not regret...
The service was great, the food was delicious, and the dessert was even better!!

Started in Beverly Hills, California in 1985 by Flax and Rosenfield, California Pizza now has over 230 locations, all pretty much "cookie cutting" in menu, service and style. As they have a large and rather innovative selection of pizzas that are generally better in quality than those of other large pizza chains, I tend to be a fan of California Pizza and would rate their food as four stars. This particular location, however, only gets three stars from me as I have been to locations which I've found to be considerably better. This particular location tends to be crowded, particularly with screaming kids whose parents seem to encourage them to be as obnoxious as possible, and slow awkward service.  On the plus side the food, especially the pizza, is standard for the chain, consistently good.

We came here when we arrived in LA from San Francisco.  We just wanted something simple after the long journey.  We shared two pizzas and both were ok. Service was ok.  The place felt a little dark though. It is a chain though so can say it was ok but nothing like wow.

By far my favorite California Pizza Kitchen! Always fantastic food, clean and great service. Love the salads, consistently good. Parking is super easy, underground free and easy escalator or elevator to their front door . Very helpful for my 89 year old momtoo:)

Oh, CPK. You were my favorite when I was teenager. But  tastes evolve as you age, so I was unsure how I'd enjoy the once ridiculously popular restaurant chain. I went with coworkers and had a decent time, Got the Chipotle Chicken pizza, and like most of their signature pies, it was basically a conventional pizza with a salad piled on top. We also got the crispy spring roll sampler for the table, pretty good. CPK holds up as a solid lunch spot. With newfangled spots like Pizza Rev and 800 Degrees angling to be your new lunch time pie destination, it's nice to know that good ol' CPK still delivers what you expect and hope for.
This is the 'Play it Safe' redundant typical restaurant. Yes the food is 'good' and the decor is monotonous. That's about as exciting as I can make this review.

Ordered pick up, got there, called, told them I was there. They said food was ready and be down shortly... Waited for 15min in my car, decided to call again and someone else answered said, oh you already called? They said food was ready and be right down. 5min. Later they came down...  I'm just pissed cause I have a lot of work to finish today and needed to eat at home as fast as possible... That was the whole point of ordering online and timing it out to pick up... Worse part is got the food home and it sucked... Their food is not the kind of food to be sitting in those boxes too long... The consistency just goes bad.
Love love love this place ! I love Ventura blvd amazing shopping experience and food!

California Pizza Kitchen is a pretty solid chain and you usually know what to expect. This particular location is in desperate need of a face lift, deep cleaning, remodel, and re-training of the kitchen staff. Three for late dinner after a movie and we decided to hit this joint. The place was deserted... staff sitting around eating and chatting. While our service was OK the tables, chairs, booths were all in need of repair. Everything just felt dirty, and don't even get me started on the men's bathroom..... The food was sad. My pizza begged for flavor... Both of my friends pasta dishes were bland, boring, and pointless. Great location and I'm sure if corporate pays some attention to this location - they can get it back on track.

In an area of town that is filled with indie restaurants and not many chains, it's surprising to see that this CPK has been going strong for quite some time. The eatery is overlooking Ventura Blvd. on the second floor of the appropriately named California Pavilion. Don't both searching up and down for a meter, they have a free (after validation) underground parking structure located at the end of the cul-de-sac on Laurelgrove! Just like any other CPK, you can take your pick of any number of pizzas including thin crust, hand tossed, and now gluten free! After looking through the many MANY options I landed on the roasted artichoke and spinach thin crust (with artichoke hearts, roasted garlic, sauteed spinach, mozzarella, parmesan). The artichoke hearts were fresh and roasted to have a nice crisp on the outside. The staff here is always very friendly and attentive, even when they're busy. The exposed kitchen is always a nice touch and if you keep an eye open you may see a pizza or two fly in the air!

The food is Amazing! I got curbside service and they were so quick and efficient to come outside. My food was ready within 20 min. And then you call and they bring it out to you. Very convenient and quick.
This place is amazing. Everyone is incredibly friendly and they even have is a free appetizer because it was our first visit!  The hummus was insanely good. Give it a shot.

Been here a few times because I like the food. The big issue for me is the parking situation and the okay service. Sometimes you get a great waiter sometimes you get a not so good waiter. Again, I come here ONLY because of the food.

CPK is my favorite chain restaurant and I always have a great time here Felt like I had to give them 5 stars today for the exceptional service we received at this location our server Daniel and his manager on duty Brenda, they were so on top of it and didn't miss a beat, it was one of the best customer service experiences we've had at any restaurant The Studio City CPK is doing something very right with their team,  thank you

Staff is very attentive here. They take care of you right away. Seated right away and the server comes to take your order as soon as you are seated.  I tried their Margharita thin crust pizza, not sure of the spelling. Very delicious and healthy I would say.  Parking: Valet only BUT 1 1/2hr is free with validation.  *Please don't forget to tip the valet drivers/workers.
I like this place, the food is pretty good; the service is very good! The place is a bit small but in general I like it, We keep coming back. I recommend!

I'm giving 1 star because I can't feel my face from the Dish I barely had. Kung pao spaghetti was way, way too Salty! I had Kung pao spaghetti at a different location that's why I know it's not supposed to taste like that. After 1 1/2 bite, I felt my face, lips, tongue, legs, side of my ears starting to swell up. I'm not the healthiest person you'll ever meet, I am the opposite of Healthy but for my Husband to hear me say it's salty. He knows right away that there is something wrong with my dish. I like salt trust me but this was too much! we told our waitress that it's too salty and she took right away and said she'll have them change. The manager I believe brought the replacement, who just sat the plate down without saying anything. Maybe, "I'm sorry about that would have been nice & let me know if this is better" but nope! we didn't hear that. I then proceed to try my replacement Kung pao spaghetti... Either the chef has a problem with me or he just love salt. It's still salty. The manager finally came back and ask how's my food. I just didn't want to say anything anymore but just told her I'll just take it to go which I should have just have her take it back since I wouldn't be able to eat anyways. They should change the name of the dish to Salty Kung Pao Spaghetti!

This place is the worst. Not only is it over crowded but the food is absolutely horrid. Let me start from the beginning. Right when I was seated I was hit with the stench of the restroom. Now my table was placed all the way across the room from the restrooms, it shouldn't be smelling this bad from across the room. Gross. My next complaint is about how over crowded it is. This is a sad excuse for a restaurant. My back was literally touching another persons. They squished way to many tables in there.  My 3rd complain is about their waiters. It took about 20-25 minutes for them to come and take our order for drinks. Not only did they take forever to ask and bring back, but they managed to mess up our drink order.  My 4th complaint is about their appetizers. I literally dream about their artichoke and spinach dip. How in the world do they manage to ruin a simple dip is amazing. Not only did the dip taste nasty but the chips were stale.  My last complaint is about their dishes. I ordered a soup with a water, and both of the dishes tasted like Clorox. I sent both back and right away my appetite disappeared.  I would never recommend this place to anyone. This place is literally disgusting and dirty. I will never come back. The management needs to step it up.

I wish I could give them 10 stars. I take my 2 boys there every friday who have autism and the staff is so understanding and amazing with them. Matt just turned three and they went out of their way to make him feel like the king. They set up the table with his fav thing TRAINS and had balloons as well. They gave him an adorable chef jacket which he slept in. He has his favorite waiter Alfredo aka freddy and he is super sweet to my kids. The managers Joe and Jane and all the staff are just incredible. The food is really yummy.  My 6 yr old gets the cheese pizza and the 3 yr old mac n cheese and i get the kung pao chicken. I have never had any issue with salt as did one reviewer and I am not a salt person. I even go to weight watchers the next day after eating it and lose so for me I don't notice sodium.  I would recommend cpk to everyone especially this location. I cant say enough on how amazing they all are when you have special needs kids and I feel safe bringing them on my own here because the staff has my back and is terrific. Again, never had a problem with their food it is yummy. I have had the tortilla soup which is yummy and a few salads. Everything very tasty.

Amazing experience ! Thank you hostess Naomi for opening the door for me and being so kind . Thank you Brittany for the great service as our waitress and thank you manager for comping us on an appetizer for no reason at all ! I'll be back very soon !!

I had the shrimp lettuce wraps as an entree. Friend had pepperoni pizza and other friend chicken Cesar salad. The lettuce wraps were so good! Plenty of shrimp. My friend who ordered the pizza apparently likes it because it was his second time ordering. Salad was good too, better than most. I also tried the butter bread with ice cream for dessert and my friend had the chocolate soufflé looking with ice cream on top. The butter bread was good, pairs well with the ice cream although it can get sweet I'd order it with coffee next time. Friend said chocolate was overwhelming. The service was for sure a 5+ stars. Very attentive. The manager I believe he was, stopped by to make sure everything was going great. I'm glad staff take the time to make sure customers are reaching full satisfaction. Thank you guys

Omg! Jan (which I think was a manager) was AMAZING!! I went in here at 3pm with a friend. It was so hot and I was so hungry I was about to pass out. My vision was blurry  and I was literally going down if i didn't get some food in my belly lol. She came over because our original waiter hadn't came over I immediately ordered and told her I was dying of starvation. She brought out bread and immediately took our orders she even let us try the first time customer complimentary flat bread. OMG she had the type of customer service I look for everywhere I go. Especially being in customer service myself for over 9 years. She made me want to eat at this location all the time now. I love where it's located and parking is free.  It's small but very clean and the staff were all very nice, but Jan she knows what she is doing and loves what she does! Thanks Jan I will always bring business to this CPK!

If you don't know the menu and want a food review go to another post, this is addressing the service and staff at this location. Although, the Hollywood and Highland location is closer, the CPK in the Valley usually is a better dining experience. The staff is always so nice I am so bad at remembering all their names but they have had waiters that remember our orders after serving us once. My friend has a physical impairment and everyone is so accommodating and helpful for him. This became a regular location for eating out very quickly. I would like to give a shout out to waitress Jackie who really makes it a great experience. (There are good things to be said of all the waiters we've had, I just only remember Jackie's name and I also meant to fill a compliment survey for her and forgot - but  everyone that has waited on us have been great.  The managers that we have met there also have been so nice and friendly. All CPK's have such great customer service skills that I have never had an absolutely terrible experience. This location really follows through with those polices and makes your evening and meal that much nicer. In Los Angeles, it sometimes can be hard to go to chain or corporate owned restaurants and have a warm experience. Many restaurants have servers who are overworked and focused on heavy sales and also have a high turnover rate and each visit can seem like they fired everyone and got new people. CPK in the Valley, has the charm and feel of a nice local restaurant.  Although, they do all that up selling but that comes from their corporate overlords and it's pretty minimal compared to some places.

The best customer service at any CPK! We were going to a CBS tapping of a show on saturday and happened upon this little hidden treasure of a CPK. The Manager and full staff were AMAZING! I just want to say Thank you for your excellent Customer service. If i am ever in the area again we will be here again and will enjoy the Flat bread Yummmmy! If i could give you ten stars i would ! Thank You
Excellent PizzA , Awsome pasta , die for desserts and all in one place .... That's here in CPK ... Chipotle pizza , cream penne pasta , butter cake and tiramisu are the favorites....
Say deliver b4 2. I've called twice b4 2 and no deliver person. Then finally there say 100 dollar minimum. WTF!!

We always order take out and they are consistently good. While we dine in it is always enjoyable being that it is a great kid friendly atmosphere. They have helped with fundraisers in the past and it's nice how this particular CPK cares about their community. Their phone customer service is above excellent everytime!

Studio City CPK is fabulous. First of all, it just had a major facelift! The new decor is super modern groovy, natural wood tables and chairs, very cool atmosphere.  We celebrated our daughters 7th birthday at this location with a few friends last week.  The manager, Joe Baylis, made our evening extra special. If you haven't met Joe before think of your favorite cool, sweet Uncle and multiply that by 100. What an amazing guy who really enjoys his job and makes every effort for people to enjoy themselves while out to eat.  Each child was given an apron (chef coat for the birthday girl!) and chef hat. Our lovely server Melanie (cute red head) made sure the kids were happy and ready to make their own pizzas. She brought them dough, sauce and all the fixins.  The kids had a blast making and designing their own pizza. Who wouldn't?  After their pizzas were ready to go into the oven, Joe Baylis arranged for the kids to have a tour of the kitchen and see their pizzas go into the oven. Melanie took the kids on the tour and introduced the kids to the nicest kitchen staff in town. After the tour, they returned to their seats and their pizzas were brought out to them.  Delicious!  We cannot thank Joe, Melanie and the entire staff at Studio City CPK enough for how kind and patient they were with our child's birthday party.  5 stars!
Easy parking can't ever go wrong with Cpk. Whether it's going upstairs to eat or taking it to go, everything is always double checked and delicious!

First the bad news; they don't take reservations and we called early to see how long it would take to seat 9 and were told about a half hour. We got there and they estimated 25 minutes. Long and short of it, it took almost an hour until they finally seated us. With that out of the way, we couldn't have had a server who was more attentive, more helpful or had a better attitude or personality than Jacqui! She turned what otherwise would have been a negative situation with me wishing that my niece, with whom we were celebrating her college graduation, would have gone elsewhere.  The food was CPK food, good and everyone enjoyed it, but Jacqui made the difference and was thanked accordingly. If you go there, see if you can sit at one of her tables!

Have been there few times since they have remodeled and added new menu items. The new food items, the fish and the steak is awesome and delicious. The manager took the time and stopped by our table and introduced himself and that was very nice touch. One interesting incident was that my wife' s phone fell in the water and the manager brought a bag if quinoa (since they did not have any rice) and I think that is what saved her phone. I highly recommend this place as you would really enjoy your time and meal there.

This branch has been one of the best restos we've been to. The manager did a great job welcoming first time guests with a warm hello and a free appetizer. The food was great especially the pizza. We went home with free cookies and a couple of discounted coupons for our next  visit. will definitely come back!

Typical chain restaurant, food is just ok. Service is a hit or miss at times. I usually only come here once in a while to have the Chicken Caesar salad which most of the time hits the spot on a hot summer day. There have been days that I've gotten the grilled chicken kind of crunchy and not tender at all so it ruins my appetite. I have tried other stuff and I've found everything is pretty much bland and mediocre. I do like the Sicilian pizza but think it's a tad bit too small for the price.. Usually only get the Sicilian pizza in the frozen pizza section at the grocery store, only place it's worth your buck.

Oh, where do I begin. Both Managers = Fail. GM = Fail - too busy getting off early and having dinner (weren't you supposed to follow-up w/me? SMH!). So I finally had to call my bank b/c CPK said they had NO RECORD of running my card 3x (I cannot believe the time wasted on calls) and they can only refund what was ran. After speaking to the female manager b/c clearly Joe is incompetent of customer service or any type of follow-up, I called my bank - at which point they told me: If CPK doesn't have / keep records of these transactions, but it was deducted from your account to theirs, it's completely illegal (...well, duh) and that they see people go through this all the time and the vendors like to take money, not give so just file a claim and don't waste any more time w/ the business. The female manager called me back after she spoke to her busy GM (at dinner) and said they'll refund my money. They wanted to keep questioning my bank. Really? Chase is stealing my money under CPK? I hardly doubt that. I sent them my bank statement via email and it still wasn't good enough b/c THEY COULD NOT FIND IT ON THEIR SIDE (not my issue - and how much tax are you not going to pay b/c of this "technical issue?") So after all that, I still had to threaten them to report them to IRS to get my refund. Will I EVER go to ANY CPK? Probably NOT. And when did their FOOD GET SO BAD? You WASTED so much of my TIME!!! But I wasn't going to give you even an EXTRA DIME!!! Corporate: call your East Coast Remote Credit Card Machine Company and fix this issue before someone reports you to IRS!!! Signed or NOT signed, the fact that you guys send ALL transactions to your bank to be processed at 4AM and NO PPWK to match??? HOW DID YOU GUYS EVEN GET SO BIG W/ SUCH A SCREWED UP OPERATION?!
Worst CPK I've ever been too. Didn't offer bread, margarita was gross, service was slow, place was filthy. SMH.

Not sure what happened with CPK, but I like it! From the bread basket (now fresh baguette with olive oil dip) to the drinks and entrees, it was all super tasty. Not the "ok" type of food I was used to in the past here. Totally coming back.

The food here is good, and the staff is friendly. This location is the closest one to my house so I frequent it every once in a while. I don't have much to complain about here, but I will say my biggest complaint is that it can get quite busy here sometimes; usually in the evening. I recently discovered that they do curb-side pickup though, so I don't have to worry about the long wait for tables; you place your order online, show up in your car curbside, call, and then they bring the food to you. It's so convenient.

I have a friend who continuously told me about the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine from CPK. I decided after a long day at work, quick take out sounded like the best choice. As soon as I walked up to the hostess stand outside I was warmly greeted and ushered inside.  My first reaction was the great ambiance of the whole place being on the second floor and having lots of windows to look out. But I was tired and just wanted to make a pick up for food. I asked the young lady about the dinner choice my friend had suggested and she verified how great it was. I hinted maybe I would like to order dessert and she kindly took the time to go through the sweets menu with me until I found something.  As I sat and waited for my order, she walked over a sample of flat bread, one of the small dishes they serve, recommending I try it since it was my first time to a CPK.  The time and effort just put into the little gestures she offered, extra bread, utensils, the sample of food, was extraordinary considering I had just walked in for take out. I was so tired and weary having a long commute home from work, but I literally left smiling and really thankful I stopped in to this location. I thanked her graciously for all her help and she mentioned her name was Jane. She also said her card was on the hostess stand. On the way out I picked up the card only come to find out she was the General Manager. wow!   Working in the Food and Beverage industry for over ten years it was a gift to have someone take the extra time and effort as Jane did just to make my first experience a memorable one. If this is the GM of the staff there who went the extra mile to accommodate me for just take out (even though my tip would not go towards her) I cannot wait to actually go and sit down to eat at this location.   Kudos to the team at CPK in studio city! I will most definitely be back!

Came here and met up with some friends for lunch.  It's nice and air conditioned inside.  I have to say, CPK has really stepped up it's game in recent years.  I haven't been to a location in 7+ years (Wow, has it been that long?!) and was really happy to see that the interior felt modern yet natural and had a pretty good menu to match.   Food is just alright though, nothing wow'd me.  The pizza was REALLY greasy.  The ceasar salad I had was just OK. TIP:  Make sure you bring your parking ticket for the lot below.  They validate for that lot.

Very disappointed to learn that the chicken on their salads isn't made in the reataurant.  Ordered the Thai crunch salad.  The chicken was so garlicky, only to find out that it couldn't even be redone.  All this b.s. with open kitchen, etc and some stuff is made elsewhere

This place is really amazing and completely changed in the best way possible! Very friendly, very helpful, very professional.  Food was absolutely fresh, nothing tastes bland or frozen. Don't really care or want to know if it possibly is anyway.  Our server Tatum was so sweet and informative, and so laid back I didn't feel like I was being served by some robot/disingenuous drone. I felt like I was just relaxing in a friends house and felt very elegant. The general manager Jane was outstanding, it was our first time at this location so she offered a complimentary  side, then when the side we ordered was unavailable because it was brand new and couldn't order it we got guac and chips... But she came over anyways and gave us the original side we ordered first. AMAZING. hospitality 100%. I definitely recommend this location for a solid experience at a first time CPK.  Very very satisfyingly full. :)

Decent food, decent prices, good wine selection, and excellent salads to go with your pizza. For a chain, I really like this joint. And they have gluten free crust options, which means the GF dough is made in an entirely separate part of the kitchen in order to accommodate patrons with severe gluten allergies. I love that! Parking here is metered street or valet behind the shopping center. Validated for 90 minutes.

Witnessed an employee say as he was walking away from a customer say "stupid white bitch" for correcting him on the order he messed up to begin with. I know cpk probably won't do anything about it tho, I think the guys name was David last bar, or something with a B. idk
Cant Go wrong, my fiance and I, Love this place ! Great Food , love the Chicken Piccatta.. We usually do curbside  but we have dined in and the service was great!
This is one of our favorite places to eat. We had a great waitress named Jackie. It's a great family restaurant. Decor is great also. I highly recommend.
By far my favorite restaurant!  Everything was perfect! The waiter, the vibe and the food!!  I ordered the thin crust tostada pizza! By far the best pizza I've had!

For years I've always been a fan of CPK but my recent visit was very disappointing. While our waitress was sweet, she seemed very distracted and kept forgetting about our table. Below is the list of the multiple problems throughout the night. 1. Salad had brown soggy lettuce 2. Ordered an iced tea that was never refilled. When they finally did refill it at the end of the meal, they replaced it with water 3. All appetizers came out at the same time as main course 4. Pizza was very cold 5. Gave waitress our CPK rewards number, credit card was charged and she forgot to give me points 6. Rewards had $10 off purchase of $40 or more, our bill was $43 but the reward didn't count since it didn't include tax This is way too many mistakes for one visit considering the restaurant was practically empty.

I had. Bad experience in CPK in this location (Studio City) few years ago, but last Sunday decided to give them another chance.  I never had a chance to eat there. When me and my friend  arrived, there was one couple in front Of us (time was around 4 pm not busy, after lunch). The host told us that he ll be back with us in few minutes and went for sit the other couple. By the time he came back, there was another group of people who came after us  but came upfront awaiting for host as well. The host returned, did not pay any attention to us and talked to other group of people. When I ask him question, what about us, he said I ll be back with you and mumble something that only he could hear. Obviously I did not want to stay in this place and told my friend, let s go. The host heard it and had no attempts to apologize for his behavior or try to keep us.  When I share my experience with few of my friends ( we are all local from Studio City), they told me that they have a bad experience in this location and prefer to go to any other location but not in Studio City.  For me this experience actually, was nice. We went to Green Apple just across CPK and had great food and excellent service. I will never go to this location again. I had to give one star since the review can not be posted without any rating...

TERRIBLE SERVICE and unapologetic!!! Phoned in an order for pick up. They said it would be ready in 20 min. After waiting 35 min at the counter I asked on the status, they said nothing was made. REALLY??? I ordered a pizza and a soup...how hard is that? The counter staff didn't even apologize and said they were slammed. Get it together CPK and STOP catering to LA BITES before your customers who are standing in front of you!

I am a huge fan of CPK, but this past visit was extremely disappointing. When we got there, I was outside waiting for a hostess to take my name and give me a quote time. There was no one to be found and I just felt like they didn't care. There was a line behind me. Eventually the host came outside to the stand and took my name down. She quoted me about 15 minutes. Not Bad.  My boyfriend and I wait inside. I am a host at a restaurant at the Americana, so I understand what they go through but the service was horrible, and we weren't even seated yet. i noticed there were a bunch of empty tables, yet there was a wait out-side the door. The take-out line was way worse.  After a couple of minutes of seeing the tables not being sat, I ask the host if they're planning anything for those tables, he says yes, then grabs some menus and takes us over to our seat. The server to my left is taking care of the 6-Top next to us, and doesn't acknowledge that we're there. Ok. Fine. Then the server to our right does the same thing. It felt like everyone around was being taken care of except us. Normally my boyfriend doesn't really mind, but this was just horrible service. We sat there for FIFTEEN MINUTES without any service. I decided to jump in the bar and just order our dinner there. The Bartender said he noticed that we weren't getting any service and that he's sorry. But even he seemed distracted... -_- We didn't get our bread until after our appetizer, and the people who sat down next to us after we had sat down got bread before we did. I love CPK but I've just been so disappointed by this restaurant lately. Won't be coming back to this location anymore for a while, hopefully they make some changes for the better.  Food was great. That's why I give 3 stars.

I have been a loyal CPK customer for many years, but the last 2 experiences have been so frustrating and disappointing that I will be taking my business elsewhere and want to warn others about the issue.   I had two identical bad experiences that both relate to pick-up orders.   With 2 hungry and tired kids, I called the restaurant to place a curbside pickup order.  I followed the directions to place an order, spoke with a person to place my order, and was told that my order would be ready at 5:00pm.  Upon arrival at curbside, I called back and followed the prompts to let them know that I was curbside.  However, the woman said she had no record of our order.  I had only ordered 1 kids cheese pizza and she said she could have it ready in 6 minutes.  By this time, my kids were already impatient, but with no other faster options available, I agreed to wait the 6 minutes. I told them that this was the 2nd time that that has happened to me and I was very frustrated.  Almost 15 minutes later the woman comes out with the kids pizza.  After a quick apology, she said, "The trick is that you have to bypass the call center and speak directly with the restaurant."  What?!? There is a "trick" to ordering that is different than what the directions on the phone explicitly say?  It is shocking to me that there should be a "trick," and that CPK has not figured this out yet and made it clear to the caller how to place a pick-up order.  At this point she saw I had 2 screaming kids in the back, I had waited 2x the amount of time that she initially told me after they had messed up/lost my order, yet she passed me the bill for the $6 kids pizza.  I do not expect to receive free food, but I expected to receive some acknowledgement of the screw up.  She told me she could let her manager know and see what they could do.  I told her I didn't have time to wait any more.  And also, I'm surprised that the manager didn't know/wasn't told about this kind of issue.     So, to the Manager of CPK:  Please address the automated instructions to place a pick-up order so that customers aren't expected to know a "trick" so that they can actually get their order.  And please take care of dissatisfied customers that are victims of your errors.   There are many other great family friendly and pizza places in the neighborhood that I will be taking my business to in the future--PizzaRev, The Counter, Loteria, Maria's, Pagliacci's, Mexicali, Lemonade, Granville, etc., etc., etc.

I brought my spouse to this location at 6:00pm on 11/28/15, and we had a great time.  Since it was early in the evening (by Los Angeles standards), we got a booth right away from a nice hostess that overlooked Ventura Blvd.  We were under the care of a very nice server named, Isabella, who was patient and very helpful.  Our dinner was great, and I appreciated the manager checking on us several times during the meal.  This restaurant was run very well on the night of our visit.  We plan to return again.

I don't usually write reviews but I just got back from a quick lunch here with the bf and the service was amazing. The host held the door for us, our waitress was super attentive and affable, even the manager came to check on us a few times. I've always been a fan of cpk but I'll definitely be back to this location specifically.

A good location to eat at. Parking is around the corner get validation at restaurant and parking will be free. I ordered pasta, delicious as always!!! We got seated quick, food came out at a good time. We also ordered dessert and it was nummy! I recommend anyone to come to this cpk!!!

This was the first time we decided to come to a California pizza kitchen. We went because we were given a gift card for Christmas. The service was fine but after a few big parties came in we were completely forgotten. The soup and salad were ok but both of our pizzas were slightly cold and the bottom of both pizzas were soggy which is really disappointing for a couple of 14 dollar personal pizzas. It took 10 mins to get our waitress or the managers attention for the check.  When I told the manager I was disappointed with the food and the fact that we were forgotten she just made a face, nodded, walked away and our waitress walked over after with the bill stating that they took off the soup from our bill... Whoop de doo.  We will never be coming here again. At least a Pizza Hut knows how to make pizza that isn't soggy, so I'm sure it's not that hard. I really expected better.
I used to love this place.. when did you all decide to make to food so darn salty :-(  Please have some one taste various dishes .. especially pasta.. vet very salty.

I came to CPK on 3/25 and my waiter was super super and my Penne Sauage and Peppers were the best I have ever tasted the manager however was nice but she doesn't smile she is very reserved but she is on top of things and I really love the new look they have now new wood flooring and new tables It felt so woodsy will I come  back most definitely
The service was ok, food was dry. I had jambalaya fettuccine with not enough sauce, noodles were dry, also why the need to leave the tails on shrimp. Curbside takes too long.

This place is horrible. I ordered a steak and asked for the butter to be left out of it. Instead after 30 minutes wait they brought it out dripping in it. I told them that I could not have it with butter. 2 minutes later they brought  out same steak, they just scraped off the butter. No apologies nothing. I remained at the table waiting for my family to finish they're dinner. As we about to leave they tried to give me to go food. Too little too late.

Its rare to have chain restaurants in LA, but it's so nice to have cpk around. This location is tucked away upstairs of a strip mall on Ventura blvd. Its pretty roomy given the smaller size.  The service has always been great, and the food has consistently been good. I'm a fan of this restaurant and convenient location.  Valet parking downstairs, along with metered street parking on Ventura.

This is the worst CPK ever I have been to. We ordered drinks and there was no ice. I had to ask for ice. I had to get my bred and olive oil by asking the manager. The girl who took cared of us she did not give us napkins I had to ask for napkins. We had to ask for our utensils to eat with. The utensils were dirty (not cleaned enough). We ordered Mac and cheese balls and Mac and cheese those were good. We ordered a pepperoni and mushroom sausage pizza and a bbq pizza Those were also good. The worst part is we ordered a gluten free pizza and the crust was very burned but the middle of the pizza was raw and the best part of the gluten free pizza is the burned part of it. We are not coming back and you should not go to. The workers should quit there jobs. The manager was very nice .

I suggest this to all the people in the world! I love the butter cake and all the desserts! They have really yummy food and also great for kids, they have a kids menu! Great for the kids to meet up with friends and have fun while the parents talk! I think this is a very fun experience for kids and adults.

I use to work at CPK (many, many, many years ago...not at this location), so my feedback may be a bit bias, and also harsh as I know exactly how a CPK should run and how the food should be. This location is a lot smaller than typical CPK locations I'm use to and kind of in a weird spot.  Service was good though and our server was friendly. My boyfriend and I both ordered pastas. They no longer have the shakers on the table (for parm. cheese) so I had to ask for some. I was surprised we weren't offered any, but no big deal. We were sitting in a corner booth and although it was a 4-top booth and it was just the two of us, it did feel a bit cramped. The tables were placed so close together, I accidentally rubbed up on the table next to me trying to leave (and I'm a pretty thin girl).

I though the cpk in Tarzana was good, well this one in Studio City was firing on all cylinders. From the sweet hostess (great name, starts with M) greet to the crew in the kitchen making everything on point and our server Joshua who was on his game from the word go.  We were all truly impressed. One thing I must mention, rarely does a dish come to you that looks exactly the same as the pictured advertisement. Thank you halibut preparer.

Eating in service is great. However, delivery sadly poor. Never includes bread. Said to ask. So asked, and still no bread. Mistakes consistently on takeout and server blames and puts onus on who picked up order to double check. Staff should double check their work!!! Also, as others have commented, portions shrinking, but not the prices.

The (free) valet was smoking. We complained at the restaurant - and they said we had to complain to the valet. The restaurant manager showed zero interest in making our experience pleasant. This is not something that was out of the restaurant's control - thus the impact on the rating.

I used to love CPK, and ate here often. However,  their new menu is horrendous. They took ALL the good items off the menu. They have relegated their pizza to a tiny portion of the menu, and there's nothing good left of their pizza menu.  I can't help but wonder why they call it "California PIZZA Kitchen" when they've removed most of the pizzas.  To add insult to injury, their sauce is horrible, and the crust boring...and burned. I cannot recommend this restaurant to anyone. The food is horrible.  I literally just threw away more than half of my pizza because it was so horrible, bordering on completely inedible. This is the first time in my life that I have been unable to eat a pizza.

The service was pretty good! The waitress was pleasant and filled up my water :)  they even gave me a free birthday Sundae complete with candle ;)?yay !  the food is your typical cpk food. Parking for this location either has to be metered  on Ventura Blvd or free valet parking with validation  for two hours.

Waited 20mins before they even took my order, then they acted like my order my was never placed so I waited another 1tmins for them to quickly make my food since it was not closing time.  I wouldn't recommend coming here unless you don't mind a rude staff who talks crap about the customer right in front of their face.  I gave 1 star because the person who took my order (not the manager who was talking crap) seemed embarrassed by the managers actions.  Other than that this was poor service.

Want to specifically point out how impressed I was with the manager Elise (I think). She was so kind. I was shivering a bit and said nothing . She was so observant turned down the Ac and told Me she saw I was cold. I was watching her behind the bar checking all the glasses and re cleaning  for quality control. Rarely see that. She continuously walked around. Greeted checked up and helped the bar all while smiling. My father and I were very impressed  Cpk most often has had great food. Big portions. My  grilled vegetable salad had more Veggies than ever. So fresh and enough leftovers for three meals. The tortilla soup was so thick and full of yummy things I filled up before dinner. My dads pizza was perfect  I met cpk founders about 20 years ago at one of their kids bar mitzvah. They had me try the pizza and was hooked. They should be very proud of how this restaurant is ran because so many aren't ran like this.  One bad take out experience years ago. But cpk fixed it right away Great job. Your service gained new regulars

Awful awful awful...bad food, terrible service.  Surprised so many like it...it was an all-around bad experience.  Ordered the salmon, had to send it back, it was dry as dust...ordered a pizza that never showed up.  The waiter never came to check on us, and there were items I had to go to the kitchen and ask for myself (like bbq sauce because my sons' bbq chicken pizza was over cooked and the sauce had all dried up)...never refilled waters, never did anything really except take the order and disappear.  The salmon never made it back to the table, guess it was hanging out with the missing pizza.  When the bill arrived, I asked to see the manager and let her know I was surprised she didn't offer to comp anything, even the drinks to which she responded "I didn't charge you for the salmon or the garlic chicken pizza" to which i thanked her and reminded her that I never actually received either of those two items.  Last time i went i said i would not go back...this time I am DEFINITELY never going back.

You may be in a small Westwood village when eating at this CPK, but beware of the college rush. During the school year (Sept.-June) this place can be packed and super busy. But when it is the lively young staff and ambience really comes to witness. This CPK has the same menu, and loving down the street has caused me to always choose a Hawaiian Pizza or BBQ Salad. If you're in need of an affordable and wonderful lunch or dinner come to this location. Also, ask for Guillermo he was a delight to be around. BEWARE: Parking in Westwood is hectic and pricey,but hey maybe you'll run into a celeb or two!

I go to the studio city cpk almost every week and today I had a waitress named Jennifer and she was  the sweetest waitress and she had so much great energy! She is by far my favorite waitress here she is so great and the food was awesome! Great service and food today!! Thanks Jennifer!

Very disappointed. We had a large takeout order and they're left up two child pizzas. when we called them instead of offering to deliver them they just wanted to reverse the charges on her credit card. Hence our kids did not get the pizza they wanted, very bad customer service. Two weeks later we still have not gotten the charges reversed on our credit card. So at this point its theft.

The service was excellent and our server and the manager were very accommodating to my 1-year-old son's allergies.  The food was great and our overall experience was really positive.  We will definitely go back!

This is one of the best CPK locations in SoCal. I have dined at several others and none are as consistent as Studio City. The pizzas are usually cooked to perfection with just the right amount of toppings. The servers are always very friendly. Parking is the worst thing about this location.
They gave us a  "new and improved" container for a "full sized" $17 salad and its TINY. Bye CPK. Sorry for being a long time customer, I guess not all things get better with time.

Caribbean Jerk Chicken Pizza! Seriously this dish itself deserves 5 stars but my parties dishes weren't so great. Has a sweet/salty texture to it. Comes in a flat thin crust and has the right amount of ingredients to perfection. I loved it. My mom had some pasta as well as my girlfriend. Her spaghetti looked heated from microwave while the meat sat at the bottom. My mom ordered hummus and a cup of soup. The hummus platter was amazing while the pita bread was heated. Location is super small so you will for sure have to wait a bit but the ambiance is good and so are the views if lucky seating next to the window.

They say there's no bad pizza, but today whoever they are have been proven wrong. $17.50 for a personal gluten free pizza that had the texture of dry rubber. Over cooked ends. Barely a drop of sauce. Our glasses sat empty at the edge of the table, begging to be refilled. I waited 5 minutes for parm as my pizza cooked. And another 10 for more sauce which was the only thing that could make the pizza tolerable to digest. I don't think I could have been more disappointed in my lunch.

I've eaten at this location several times over the years; haven't been back in a while. Nice and friendly staff and service. I have no complaint with the taste of the food but rather the portions. I had the Moroccan Chicken Salad which was tasty. My sister in law actually craved the Kung Pao Chicken Pasta (hence why we came) however she was highly disappointed as she barely had any Chicken in it. I guess she's not interested in coming back for it in future.The BBQ Chicken Pizza was decent. For the price paid, other level restaurants are more generous with portions and meat portions. If that doesn't turn you off, make sure you get the Butter Cake ala mode.... it's tasty.

This is a much smaller CPK so there are no wait times like the other ones. I like the more intimate setting this location provides, however I must say the service is lacking compared to what we get at the one in Glendale.   The waitress was on the slower side of life, and wasn't even able to take our order without us repeating it several times.  However, Kudos to the chef here; he really cooks with his heart and soup and it shows in how his food tastes. I really enjoyed my chicken penne pesto cream pasta. Out of all the CPK's this chef prepared it with the perfect flavorful sauce, and the chicken portion was actually enough and not stingey for once.  We also ordered a pizza which was too little on the cheese, but overall everything was great and didn't take too long to come out.  I also love their mango strawberry cooler, it is only $2.50 and is a must try for the summer heat! It is light in calories too.

I've never been so disappointed in my most recent visit. The waiter would look at us and rolled their eyes. He had a really big attitude. But the food never lets me down!! The pasta is always a must have!!

I ordered BBQ chicken pizza take out when I got home and opens the box this is the pizza that greeted me.  Think itismissing some toppings that makes the pizza we know and love.  I called and they were great about apologizing didn't offered to send a coupon which I thought was good customer service but doesn't help with dinner tonight

I always enjoy coming to this California pizza kitchen people remember you and truly welcome you. Jose is always a wonderful server Phil makes awesome drinks! Service has always been exceptional and I have been to California pizza kitchen's from here to Hawaii! Thank you for always trying new items on your menu and keeping the things that we truly like! Studio city location you have A+ rating.
The girl working on pick up counter doesn't want to talk with the costumer that's doesn't look nice.she has a bad   that's why I ll giving 1 star

today normally we sit at the bar however we took a seat at a table . The server was great however the manager was awful. I found a small piece of hair in my chicken I showed the sever as she took my plate she even had the nerve to ask if I wanted to eat the rest of my pasta . Management usually comes over to comp something or at least apologize for the hair being in my food however we got none of the above . No comp we paid for the full bill . We will most likely never go back to this Cpk .

I have updated my old review from a while back. Although CPK is still VERY skimpy on its bread portions, the food has gotten better recently, and the service is SO great. Super friendly and professional staff! Newly renovated space seems more spacious and open.
Amazing food, very large portions, more than enough for leftovers. A bit on the pricy side and the service was not the best, we had to wait forever to have our water refilled.

A NEW & IMPROVED KITCHEN AMBIANCE parking available underneath the plaza or 2 hour metered street parking 8am-8pm. free after 8pm. located on the busy boulevard of Ventura, an upstairs restaurant with a great view tonpeople watch while dining. New and revamp decor. I remember this restaurant being basic with bright white lights and old brown outdated linen booths. after the remodel, beautiful contemporary design to CPK, with sustainable materials, open kitchens and rustic feeling decor with decorative wine on the walls. SERVICE Couldn't say enough nice things. Upon arriving, a very nice hostess greets us and seats us in a 4 top table. Perfect for me because i hate sitting in a 2 top. Restaurant manager greets us upon sitting down and takes our drink order while awaiting our assigned waiter. We met our waiter who was very cordial, friendly & courteous. Manager was constantly checking in on us to make sure we were okay. I can't express enough how much I appreciate restaurants where I see a restaurant manager involved in customer service and assisting their staff!!!! Commendable! DRINKS Full bar. My choice for the night was a Passion Fruit Mango Iced tea. Unsweetened and ZERO calories FOOD Periodical change on the menu is well noticed and appreciated. They have been revamping their menu as well towards the health conscious side, which is perfect for the Studio City population. $14.49 CHICKEN&SHRIMP LETTUCE CUPS: fresh shiitake mushrooms, water chestnuts and scallions with spicy ginger soy. THESE ARE SO YUMMY. Guiltfree and tasty!!!! I do add Cholula hot sauce to my lettuce cup which adds even more flavor!!!! MOUTHWATERING! $12.59 THAI CRUNCH SALAD + $3.50 fresh avocado: crispy veggies, cilantro, peanuts, edamame, wontons and rice sticks tossed in thai pranut dressing. FRESH, light and delicious. the crunchiness i get from this salad is my favorite part. Everything goes well together. Eat fast before the wontons get soggy  ----------- NEW ON THE MENU 04/25 -----------   $20.49 LEMONGRASS CHICKEN: ** pan roasted chicken in a lemon grass ginger glaze over stir fry baby bakchoy, farro, shiitake mushrooms and red chilli. WHAT AN AMAZING FLAVOR! the flavors incorporated and that you get from this dish is asian infused and unique.  very tasty. Chicken was soft and juicy. Bakchoy was perfectly cooked and added a fun crunch to the dish. Overall, a healthy CPK is always a win. Amazing, affordable, guilt free food Great and quick service.

I stop by this past weekend the service was great they have always have new items on the menu which is great. Unfortunately the drink was not the best I try the new cosmo , the drink taste just like cranberry juice had no liquor taste on top of that they only give half a glass which is very odd. $10 for for about 3oz of juice not worth it!

I'm surprised this place doesn't have a 5 star rating. Literally everything i have tried here is amazing. My top favorites are: Tortilla soup Buffalo cauliflower Chicken eggrolls Tequila fettucine pasta Bbq chicken pizza Thai salad

Currently here and having the BEST service I have ever had a CPK. My food came out quick and perfect, was offered cholula with my pizza and it's delicious. All of a sudden I get surrounded by managers apologizing that my flatbread isn't perfect to their standards and they want to make me a new one....  I'm literally in awe because, to me, it's delicious. I freaking love it. I immediately say no no please it's so good. I'm just blown away by the level of service and attention to detail.  I'm the girl at the bar! THANK YOU EVERYONE WORKING TODAY MAY 8th at 1:30pm.
Ordered takeout and had it brought down to me at the curbisde parking. The girls are always so amazing! Friendly, and quick!

Been a long time fan and customer of California pizza kitchen and we've never been disappointed until last night. My family of six went there and from beginning to end it was a major disappointment. The restaurant was freezing and we asked our waitress to please see if they could get the air turned down but to no avail finally had to ask the manager which she did. The service was terrible-nothing arrived at the same time and to top it off my pizza was cold.We won't be returning again for sure even though it is in our neighborhood

Tonight, my wife and, I decided to have dinner here, and I think we would've been better off, going somewhere else. I have been eating at California Pizza Kitchen since it started catching on (circa 1990's) here throughout the Southland, and within the last ten years, I've noticed a gradual decline in customer service. Although, their servers are halfway decent, there isn't that customer to server connection that there was, years ago. Our night began with what seemed like two teenaged girls at the outside entrance taking our names down, to get us a table. I had asked for a booth, and was quickly accommodated. Shortly after we sat down, two menus were slide across the table, as we were told our server would be right with us. For starters, we ordered their classic Spinach - Artichoke Dip along with the Avocado Club Egg rolls. They tasted just like mini Club Sandwiches but, I could tell they used liquid smoke to help ramp up the flavor. Being a Chef, I can tell that Bacon, if cured properly, wouldn't need any additives like Liquid Smoke. Next, I dipped into the Spinach - Artichoke Dip. It tasted creamy as always but, I noticed they were offering less, as far as portion size goes. Just as we were finishing the appetizers, our entrees finally arrived. I had the Hearth Roasted Halibut on a Cedar Plank with roasted Asparagus, butternut Squash, Farro, and baby Kale. The fish tasted very good. It was tender and, juicy but, a bit under seasoned for my palette. The Asparagus, and Squash were cooked perfectly. My wife had the Thai Crunch Salad, (which ended up being too spicy for her to eat, so we had to send it back.) and, to drink, we had Strawberry Lemonade, and an Iced Tea, without Lemon. After the bad experience with my wife's meal, we asked for the check,(which they conveniently took their time with) so that we could leave. Oh, and, we never were asked if we wanted refills on our drinks, nor were we asked how everything was. I guess, these days, the staff have better things to do than to care about customer service. Honestly? I regretfully say, California Pizza Kitchen isn't what it used to be. Save your money, and try someplace else.

Ok... so, we went there for "Date Night", and it turned into a semi-borderline frustration fest. My hubby ordered the halibut... which he said was great. However, I ordered the crunchy Thai salad and had a less than favorable experience. Don't get me wrong, the flavor was 100% there, and it tasted wonderfully, but what they neglected to mention in the description on the menu was that the dressing was spicy. So, for someone who has ulcers and chronic acid reflux, having spicy anything is no bueno. So, I returned the salad and asked to have the item removed from the bill (which they happily did), and gave me a menu so I could order something less taxing on my digestive system. After I browsed the menu, I had finally made a selection and waited for the server to return. Then waited some more, and another 20 minutes on top of that. By the time the server came back, my husband was already done with his meal; there was really no point in ordering anything else since my hubby was already done. I then asked the server for the check... another ten minutes passes, and the check finally came. I gave him my card, then it took another ten minutes for him to bring it back. The only reason why I am giving this review two stars is because the service stunk like five day old, overly worn gym socks, but the food was good.

I am a big fan of the salads at CPK, but the last two visits have left me disappointed. Today the lettuce in my $16. salad was so soggy some pieces were translucent. It was really disappointing. I sure hope they can get it together and continue to serve the fresh salads which have made me a loyal customer.

"I hear somethin' sayin' That's the sound of the men...... working on the chain ga-a-ang, That's the sound of the men working on the chain gang...... All day long they're singin'.... (Hooh aah) (hooh aah) - (Hooh aah) (hooh aah)..." _________________ Sam Cooke ^ - "Chain Gang" (1960) Admittedly, all of that "hoo'ing" and "aah'ing" resonates as somewhat of a turn on. While my libido"s racing, what better aphrodisiac,....than food itself?  Well my fellow horny,.... I mean, uhm.....HUNGRY Yelpers, you're in luck. CPK is here just in time to tickle your fancy. But it's best we do our homework prior to commencing within this review. A "chain restaurant" as defined by Google, is depicted as being: "Any restaurant with a "headquarters" (usually in another state). Any restaurant with more than 10 units and/or any restaurant with Corporate Regulatory Structures." As we're aware this can have it's definite share of pros ANDDDD cons. I mean hell, we've all viewed McDonald's locations that can't get it right to save their own lives and we've just as easily viewed franchise success stories like Fat Burger, In-N-Out and Starbucks that seemingly blow your mind by delivering "satisfaction" EACH AND EVERY TIME. Emphasis on "BUH-LOWWW"! Well, my lovelies California Pizza Kitchen (CPK for "us" regulars) falls into the latter end of the aforementioned bracket and with over 200 locations to date, some of which are international, this is palpably the SINGLE ONE franchise that actually got the memo in doing things COMPLETELY right! (.....bows to pay homage.... "I'm not worthy.") Home of the "perfect pizza", this particular location - flatbread'ing on Ventura Blvd. within Studio City just somehow does it for me!  Parking is (somewhat) accessible and the views from upstairs are spectacular. To be frank, I don't even much care for pizza. I attribute that to my Cal Poly days of late night flatbread and Ramen noodle binges. I mean seriously,.....we were sooooo- broke that we could barely afford to pay attention and pizza was pretty much all that we could collectively scrounge up funds for simply to satisfy our late night cravings. Need I say more???  Well, take my word for it when I say that, what Domino's and Pizza Hut may have ruined for me then, CPK has DEFINITELY managed to redeem. We're talking carne asada pizzas, wild mushroom pizzas and the list goes on and on like Donkey Kong's schlong!!!! If you can think it, THEY CAN MAKE IT!!!, and the bliss doesn't eclipse there as the salad selections are just as wonderful as is their variance of other options, i.e. the jambalaya!  #Yazz-Gawd'! This Southern inspired dish should be illegal! It's sinfully DELICIOUS and encompasses a bit a new age flare on an otherwise classic fave-!!! #somebody-spank-&-cuff-me!!! Alas,.... what CPK has managed to do, ladies and famished Yelping gents, is THEIR HOMEWORK. Sharpening their pencils on the perfection of culinary preparation as well as erasing any such misconceptions of subpar customer service.  I find that feat, to be orgasmic, within itself. The result of their having attended a session or two of summer school is this certifiably happy camper, whose thrilled to provide 5 stars while fervently testifying that "CPK ......... CP-Slays!!!"

So I went to CPK the other night and had my first absolutely awful experience a couple nights ago, but I'm not going to base my single yelp review off of my first and only experience at this restaurant. Let's just say our server was also the bartender and the only time we saw her was when she took our order, filled our drinks (after) our entire meal, and to give us the check. A hostess ended up checking on us to make sure we were okay when we ran out of bread and ended up bringing us more instead of our server as well as when our food items were on the counter a brilliant server named Carl brought us our dishes, which were ignored by MULTIPLE employees specifically waiting for their table's dishes. We ended up finding our initial server behind the bar serving the 3 people she had sitting up there. To be honest, I get it she had to be the bartender and on the floor but you should not have someone work both if they cannot give decent service to both. The only time we saw her was after the seats at the bar cleared and we were already done with our meal. Again, this CPK is great and this is just about the only bad experience I've ever had here but it was really really bad.

CPK is my fav. The food is great and I love the setting. Love coming here to Studio City because the service is great and they are all so welcoming. Tara was out waitress this time and she was so sweet and accommodating. Come on by if your in the area!

I feel so bad giving this review cause ive always loved CPK especially in newport beach. But its become one of those places where the food looks really good in the pictures but taste like absolute shit. Im not sure what happened their food used to be so good. The pizza was so bland and wet, the dumplings were drenched in chives and cilantro. It might be different if there prices werent so high. Literally got two small flatbread pizzas and two appetizers for 70$. And the dishes were dirty. The service was so nice though I honestly couldnt complain about the food to them. This place is really not worth your money, I hope it changes.
Great service. Food was made perfect and fresh! Couldn't have had a better first CPK experience for a first time in Cali.
I just love CPK..the food is ALWAYS good..service Always good..and I have enjoyed it over 30 years now!!!!
Tonight the restaurant was super packed short staffed but Jose made the experience wonderful!!! Food and service was on point!!! Thank you Jose

We frequent this CPK location, but the service we received last night was probably the worst we've received at this CPK or any CPK for that matter. We're probably in this CPK or the Encino location at least once a week. Understandably, it was a busy Friday evening and they were backed up. However, it took about 20min from the time we ordered drinks before they arrived. These were not specialty drinks... just simple straight pours.  During that time, the server stopped by 2-3 times saying it would be one moment because the bartender was backed up. What was even more frustrating is there was never an apology. The server was so cavalier about it with comments like "it'll be just a minute guys" as we saw others around us being served. When the drinks came, we declined them and decided to leave since we were over it.  Again, we totally understand being busy... but at least have the employees trained to properly make the situation right.

Not usually a fan of major chains but there's no denying CPK is yummy every.single.time. Excellent service, delicious individual pizza and salad (great lunch special) and fair pricing. If you're up for major ambiance and super creative culinary experience, drive on. But meeting a friend for a meal and want to catch up in a comfy booth with satisfying food (including complimentary scrumptious bread), friendly service and no super loud music blaring? Next stop, CPK.

Just had a great dinner here. Our server, (Mo), was incredibly accommodating. We had to switch out some drinks and also ask for a bunch of extras and she had an amazing attitude about it and made our dining experience very enjoyable. Would definitely recommend this location to anyone wanting some good pizza or pasta in Studio City!

For someone with lots of food allergies, you'd never expect them to actually like a CALIFORNIA PIZZA KITCHEN, considering PIZZA is in the name of the restaurant and I can't eat pizza... That being said, don't be fooled by the name, this sit down chain restaurant has SO MUCH TO OFFER, I actually bet the restaurant secretly wants to change its name to California Kitchen.  I've been once before (different location) and really did love what I got... So much so, I ordered it again, and while the portion was pretty small (despite getting both chicken and salmon to top off my vegetable salad), I loved it none the less. NOW THAT is saying something for me too because typically even if Food is good, I get really upset when the portions are small. My husband and our friends all REALLY enjoyed their meals too: my husband got the chicken fettachini Alfredo with broccoli, and our friends got the rib eye and Caesar Salad with Milinase Chicken. YUM! We were all happy campers.  To top off the meal, we ordered the butter cake and the chocolate cake. While the chocolate cake was a HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT that was taken away from our table (and we weren't charged for it) the BUTTER CAKE was out of this world. So if you do eat sweets, that dessert is HIGHLY recommended by my friends and husband! I'll be making CPK a staple in my husband and my restaurant rotation, despite the service being slightly slow... Again, it was worth it.  Oh and I have to note, our server at this location, Jamie... PHENOMENAL! Friggin' loved her. If she weren't working I totally would have asked her to pull a chair up and join us. Oh wait, even though she WAS WORKING, I still asked her to pull a chair up, ha ha!

Who doesn't like CPK? it's always fun to eat here a groups of friends or a date. The portions are great and everything I've had has been tasty. My go to is bbq chicken salad and Thai pizza. There are many great dishes but remember don't fill up on the bread. Lol
Good food casual dinner is a great thing to have at this place. I love CPK food and I like the cauliflower, I like their pizza.

Loved every second here! I got two apps and both were very delicious... chicken dumplings and avocado with chips. The table got 6 entrees and we split each one... four pizzas: Spinach Avocado with Greens, BQQ Chicken with onions, Cajun Jerky Chipotle, and Dry Roasted Garlic Chicken. BQQ was good as always. Cajun had a mild kick and was very filling in a good way. Dry roasted was a bit bland. Spinach Avocado was really good all the mixtures really complemented each other. Bolognese Pasta was very meaty and filling, loved it as the finisher. The dessert was out of this world... NOT KIDDING, no regret getting it and my spoon couldn't be dropped for the Caramel Whip Cream Pudding. MUST GET THIS
One and done. Service was meh and the food was blah. I wouldn't come to this location if they paid me.
